page.title: 03EDUCATION. KNOWL HILL SCHOOL
page.content:
In{1846}the Church of England authorities founded an Elementary School in Knowl Hill, next to St. Peter's Church. The school consisted of a Headmaster's house with schoolroom attached. Over the years some changes were made, but the major one was in{1972} when the house was demolished and a large new classroom block built in its place.
The school is now a Church of England (Controlled) Primary School.
At the side of the new classroom, which is used by the Junior pupils, there is a beautiful garden with a small pool, fountain and waterfall. This garden is called{Puggles Puddle. It was built in memory of an 11 year old boy who was killed on his way home from school in June 1983.
